body.p:
Head Quarters 1st Brigade 3rd Division
Army of Kentucky, Lexington KyNov 7th 1862
Gov Robnison

Lieut Thomas A, Elkin of the 19th Kentucky Vols, has been associated with me in the Army for almost nine months. I have known him intimately during that time. He having acted as aid while I had charge of a brigade and having continued as such with Genl Baird, my successor, in the same brigade.
He is an Excellent young man, of generous impulses and an honorable ambition; diligent and active in the performance of his duties; and of unquestioned courage and integrity.
He has proved himself to be most valuable and efficient in the public service -- improving rapidly by Experience and growing every day in usefulness.

He well deserves promotion, and I can say with truth that among the many young Kentuckians, I know in the army, not one merits it more than he. I am sure he would put forth all his powers in honest & patriotic acts of devotion to his Country.

with great respect I am your truly
John Coburn
Col & c

19
Hd. qrs. 1st Brig. 3rd Divn
Army of Ky. Lexington Ky.
Novr 7. 1862.
Coburn John
Col &c.
Recomdg Lt. Thos. A Elkin
